sen.j: 文楽（ぶんらく）は、本来操り人形浄瑠璃専門の劇場の名である。
sen.e: Bunraku originally referred to playhouses especially for performing ningyo joruri (traditional Japanese puppet theater).
"Bunraku" originally referred to playhouses especially for performing ningyo joruri (traditional Japanese puppet theater).
sen.cmt: Bunraku にダブルコーテーションを追記しました。
sen.e: "Bunraku" originally referred to playhouses especially for performing ningyo joruri (traditional Japanese puppet theater).

sen.j: しかし、現在、文楽といえば一般に日本の伝統芸能である人形劇、人形浄瑠璃（にんぎょうじょうるり）を指す代名詞的存在である。
sen.e: At present, however, it is synonymous with ningyo joruri, one of Japan's traditional performing arts.
At present, however, it is synonymous with ningyo joruri, one of Japan's traditional performing arts.
At present, however, it is synonymous with ningyo joruri, one of Japan's traditional performing arts.

sen.j: 文楽座の始まりは、淡路仮屋の植村文楽軒が「西の浜の高津新地の席」という小屋を大坂高津橋南詰で建てて、興行したのが始まりとされる。
sen.e: It is said that Bunraku-za Theater started when Bunrakuken UEMURA of Awajikariya set up a hut called "Seats in Kozujinchi, Nishinohama" at Minamizume, Kozu-bashi Bridge, Osaka and gave a performance there.

sen.e: It also is listed in "Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity" based on Convention for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage, and it is practically certain to be registered as an intangible cultural asset at the first registration scheduled for September, 2009.

tit.e: Sangyo (three professions: tayu, shamisen player, and puppeteers)

sen.j: 文楽は男性によって演じられる。
sen.e: Bunraku is performed by males.

sen.j: 文楽太夫、文楽三味線、文楽人形遣いの「三業（さんぎょう）」で成り立つ三位一体の演芸である。
sen.e: It is entertainment played by a trinity, which consists of Sangyo (the collective term of three types of performer in ningyo joruri), that is, Bunraku Dayu, Bunraku shamisen and Bunraku puppeteer.
It is entertainment played by a trinity, which consists of sangyo; tayu (narrator or chanter), shamisen player, and puppeteers.

sen.j: 客席の上手側に張りだした演奏用の場所を「床」と呼び、回転式の盆に乗って現れた太夫と三味線弾きが、ここで浄瑠璃を演奏する。
sen.e: The place for performance which is thrown out toward the left side of the audience is called "yuka" (musicians' stage), where Dayu and the shamisen player perform joruri after appearing on the rotating tray.

The place for performance which is thrown out toward the right side of the audience is called "yuka" (musicians' stage), where the tayu and shamisen player perform joruri after appearing on the rotating tray.

sen.j: 対して人形のことを「手摺」と呼ぶが、これは人形遣いの腰から下が隠れる板のことを手摺ということから。
sen.e: Puppets are called "Tesuri" because the boards which conceal the puppeteer below his waist are called Tesuri.

sen.j: 1人で物語を語るのが基本で、情景描写から始まり多くの登場人物を語り分けるが、長い作品では途中で別の太夫と交代して務める。
sen.e: Basically one Dayu chants the whole story, describing scenery and performing many characters, but in a long story he may be replaced by another Dayu in the midst of the performance.

sen.j: なお、太夫名（芸名）の場合、1953年（昭和28年）以前は「太夫」と表記していたが、以後は「大夫」と表記するようになった。
sen.e: In Dayu-mei (stage name), dayu was represented with kanji (Chinese characters) meaning a "stout man" before 1953, but since then it has been represented with kanji meaning a "big man."
In tayu-mei (stage name), tayu was represented with kanji (Chinese characters) meaning a 'stout man' before 1953, but since then it has been represented with kanji meaning a 'big man.'

sen.j: また、「若大夫」のように「太夫」「大夫」の前が2拍の場合は「たゆう」、「義太夫」「越路大夫」のように2拍以外の場合は「だゆう」と読む。
sen.e: Furthermore, dayu is pronounced as "tayu" when two beats exist before it (for example, "Wakatayu"), and pronounced as "dayu" in other cases (such as "Gidayu" or "Koshiji Dayu").

sen.j: 古くは1つの人形を1人の人形遣いが操っていたが、1734年に『芦屋道満大内鑑』で三人遣いが考案され、現在では3人で操るのが普通である。
sen.e: In ancient times one puppet was manipulated by one puppeteer, but in "Ashiyadoman Ouchikagami" of 1734 the way of manipulating a puppet with three people was created, and now it is common that one puppet is manipulated by three puppeteers.

In ancient times one puppet was manipulated by one puppeteer, but the way to manipulate a puppet with three people was invented at "Ashiyadoman Ouchikagami" in 1734, and now one puppet is usually manipulated by three puppeteers.

sen.j: 文楽の演者らで作る福利厚生団体・『むつみ会』の元代表理事・豊竹十九大夫（とよたけ とくたゆう）が、同会の資金資金約5,000万円を、銀行口座から不正に引き出していたことが発覚した。
sen.e: It was discovered that Tokutayu TOYOTAKE, a former head director of the welfare group of bunraku performers "Mutsumi kai," unduly withdrew fifty million yen of the group's fund from the bank account.
It was exposed that Tokutayu TOYOTAKE, a former head director of the welfare group of bunraku performers "Mutsumi kai," unduly withdrew 50 million yen of the group's fund from the bank account.
sen.cmt: discovered を exposed に修正しました。fifty を 50 に修正しました。※原文「資金資金約5,000万円」は「資金5,000万円」の誤りと思われます。なお、ウィキペディアの原文を確認しましたが当該部分は削除されていたため、確認できませんでした。
sen.e: It was exposed that Tokutayu TOYOTAKE, a former head director of the welfare group of bunraku performers "Mutsumi kai," unduly withdrew 50 million yen of the group's fund from the bank account.

sen.j: これを受け、同会は、2007年11月24日に臨時総会を開き、十九大夫を業務上横領罪の疑いで告訴・告発する方針を決めた。
sen.e: Because of this, the group held an extraordinary general meeting on November 24, 2007 and resolved to charge Tokutayu for, and to denounce him as being guilty for, professional embezzlement.
Because of this, the group held an extraordinary general meeting on November 24, 2007 and resolved to charge Tokutayu for, and to denounce him as being guilty for, professional embezzlement.
Because of this, the group held an extraordinary general meeting on November 24, 2007 and resolved to charge Tokutayu for, and to denounce him as being guilty for, professional embezzlement.

sen.j: また、文楽協会は、十九大夫との契約を11月25日付で解除。
sen.e: Furthermore Bunraku Kyokai terminated its contract with Tokutaro as of November 25 that year.
